physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity was 20/30 in the right eye and 20/100 pinholing to 20/25 in the left eye. A remarkable 'roughened granular' pattern of the RPE was observed without widespread atrophy or bone spicule pigmentation.

Visual acuity was 20/25 in the right eye and 20/30 in the left eye. Patches of RPE atrophy were noted in the left eye. Goldmann perimetry showed peripapillary atrophy and enlarged blind spots. Electroretinograms showed no abnormalities.

Fundus examination revealed a small subfoveal hemorrhage in the right eye. Visual acuity dropped from 20/60 in the right eye to 20/80 over 24 hours. Fluorescein angiography showed staining but no definitive CNV lesion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuity dropped significantly from 20/60 to 20/80.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuity dropped to 20/400 pinholing to 20/200. Goldmann perimetry showed a central scotoma in the right eye. A small hemorrhage was detected, and mild hyperfluorescence under the fovea was consistent with a very small CNV lesion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: An abrupt decrease in visual acuity from previous measurements was noted.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild macular edema noted. Fundus examination revealed a roughened, granular pattern of the RPE and irregular pigmentation without widespread atrophy. Central scotoma visible in the right eye on Goldmann perimetry.
Reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction confirmed the splicing of exon 6 directly to exon 8, absence of exon 7.
